story.kicker_image_caption: Nuwan Kulasekara played 21 Tests for Sri Lanka. (Reuters Photo)
story.storykicker: The right-arm pacer has represented Sri Lanka in 21 Test matches and picked up 48 wickets since making his debut in April 2005.
story.storybody:
Sri Lanka seamer Nuwan Kulasekara has announced his retirement from Tests to focus on limited-overs cricket. The right-arm pacer has represented Sri Lanka in 21 Test matches and picked up 48 wickets since making his debut in April 2005.

"I would like to retire from playing Test cricket with immediate effect. After much thought I believe it is the right time to retire and I hope it will allow me to better prepare for ODI and T20 cricket, which I would like to continue playing for Sri Lanka subject to good performance and selection," Kulasekara said.

Kulasekara didn't had the pace but could effectively move the new ball and his best Test performance would be the two four-wicket hauls against Pakistan in Colombo in 2009. At the end of that match, he had figures of 8 for 58 in 28.4 overs.

His last Test match was in Lord's in June 2014, where Sri Lanka hung on to seal a thrilling draw. However, he has not part of the playing XI, where Sri Lanka beat England in Headingley to clinch a historic series win.

Kulasekara has played 173 one-dayers and had a terrific 2009 season, where he was ranked as the No.1 bowler.

story.shortheadline: Sri Lanka's Nuwan Kulasekara retires from Test cricket

story.strapheadline: Nuwan Kulasekara is an asset in limited-overs cricket.

briefcase_content.briefcase: Kulasekara has played in 21 Tests for Sri Lanka.
Kulasekara finished with 48 wickets since his debut in 2005.
